Posts.Content: I have a palpable lump (3 o'clock left breast) and the report reads, "axillary tails reveal benign appearing lymph node" on the left side. What does that mean? Also the impression: benign findings (Birads category 2). Can you explain this term to me? Thank you Jane
Posts.Title: Mammogram results

Posts.Content: Thank you so much for taking the time to respond. Of coarse the physician didn't explain the medical terms with me. Benign should have been enough, but the report left me with questions. I am so grateful for this forum and those who take the time to care. Thank you Margie!
Posts.Title: Mammogram results

Posts.Content: Hello! Thank you for taking the time to respond. I am 40 years old. No history of breast cancer in my family, however my mother had a cyst removed when she was in her 40's. Partial hysterectomy at 29. No hormone therapy. I would have to have an order for an MRI, correct?
Posts.Title: Palpable lump but negative mammorgam and ultrasound

Posts.Content: Hello Thank you so much for your time. If nothing can be seen on ultrasound how will the site of biopsy be determined.
Posts.Title: Palpable lump but negative mammorgam and ultrasound
